channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Here they are: The best student podcasts in America
item.description: For the 2025 NPR Student Podcast Challenge, we've listened to nearly 2,000 entries from around the U.S., and narrowed them down to 11 middle school an...

item.title: Nepal's prime minister resigns following violent protests against social media ban
item.description: Nepal's prime minister resigned Tuesday following violent protests against a ban on social media platforms and government corruption.

item.title: Trump's Medicaid cuts will hurt children's hospitals
item.description: The GOP said its overhaul of Medicaid was aimed at reducing fraud and getting more adult beneficiaries to work. Among the likely side effects: fewer s...

item.title: A new Nation's Report Card shows drops in science, math and reading scores
item.description: It's the first Nation's Report Card since the Trump administration began making cuts to the U.S. Education Department. The scores reflect the state of...

item.title: The 2025 Student Podcast Challenge Honorable Mentions
item.description: Here are the honorable mentions from this year's Student Podcast Challenge, chosen from nearly 2,000 entries.

item.title: Florida radio station borrows Trump to be its face and name
item.description: Florida country radio station WHEL rebranded itself "Trump Country" 93.7 FM on the day President Trump was inaugurated for his second term.

item.title: 9/8: The Daily Report
item.description: Nancy Chen reports on newly released content in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation, and several significant rulings from the Supreme Court.

item.title: 9/8: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: Trump admin. announces immigration crackdown in Chicago; Connecticut, Rhode Island sue Trump admin. for halting work on offshore wind farm

item.title: At least 10 dead after train crashes into bus in Mexico
item.description: An investigation is under way after a freight train hit a bus as it tried to cross railway tracks.

item.title: Murdochs reach deal in succession battle over media empire
item.description: Lachlan Murdoch will retain control of the conservative Fox and News Corp empire under the deal.

item.title: More than 20 dead in Russian attack on Ukrainian village, Zelensky says
item.description: A Russian air strike on a village in eastern Ukraine's Donetsk region has killed multiple civilians, President Zelensky has said.

item.title: Greta Thunberg's Gaza flotilla hit by drone, organisers claim
item.description: Global Sumud Flotilla says a fire was started but Tunisian authorities deny that a drone was involved.

item.title: Firefighter at Grand Canyon wildfire suffers deadly cardiac emergency
item.description: A firefighter working at the scene of a wildfire burning since July at the Grand Canyonâ€‹ died Monday after suffering a cardiac emergency, authorities ...

item.title: US lawmakers release Epstein 'birthday book' with alleged Trump note
item.description: The White House says the president did not draw the picture or sign the note, after it was published on Monday.

item.title: Nepal's prime minister steps down amid deadly anti-government protests
item.description: Protests in Nepal over a since-lifted ban on major social media platforms have left almost 20 people dead and now toppled the country's leader.

item.title: Home Depot stores, long a hub for day laborers, now draw immigration agents out on raids
Most US adults think individual choices keep people in poverty, new AP-NORC/Harris poll finds
item.description: A new AP-NORC poll finds that most U.S. adults think personal choices are a major driver of poverty and homelessness, while fewer blame a lack of gove...

item.title: Supreme Court lifts restrictions on LA immigration stops set after agents swept up US citizens
